scenario:
Intercontinental Exchange (ICE) shares rallied 4.5% after reporting earnings, showing solid growth and an earnings beat. The company's business model is a mix of recurring subscriptions and trading activity, which can grow in volatile market conditions. 

In Q4, ICE grew revenue 5% to $2.32 billion, with adjusted non-GAAP earnings per share growing 14% to $1.52, both beating analyst expectations. Core Exchange revenue grew 9%, with energy and interest rate derivative trading leading the way. Fixed income revenue was up 3%, with recurring analytics subscriptions up 5%. Mortgage technology was up 1%.

ICE guided for recurring revenue growth in 2024: Exchange recurring revenue up low-single digits, Fixed Income and Data Services recurring revenue up mid-single digits, and Mortgage Technology recurring revenue up low-to-mid single digits. The company generates significant transaction revenue, which made up almost half of revenues last year.

ICE is considered fairly valued, with a GAAP P/E ratio of 40 times earnings, but adjusted earnings may be more indicative of the company's true earnings power. On an adjusted basis, ICE made $6.07 in 2024, up 8%, bringing the P/E ratio down to 27.8 times trailing earnings. The company has a solid track record and growing dividend, making it a high-quality compounder at a reasonable price.
